qas.question: What did many Romans claim in the Republican era?
What style of claim did Romans favor as a link to the gods?
What deity did the Julii claim as an ancestor?
Of what were such claims of deity relations the start?
What author further elaborated on the imperial claim of godhood?

context: Just as Rome itself claimed the favour of the gods, so did some individual Romans. In the mid-to-late Republican era, and probably much earlier, many of Rome's leading clans acknowledged a divine or semi-<a0_0>divine ancestor<a0_0/> and laid <a1_0>personal claim<a1_0/> to their favour and cult, along with a share of their divinity. Most notably in the very late Republic, the Julii claimed <a2_0>Venus Genetrix<a2_0/> as ancestor; this would be one of many foundations for the <a3_0>Imperial cult<a3_0/>. The claim was further elaborated and justified in <a4_0>Vergil<a4_0/>'s poetic, Imperial vision of the past.
